job_title: in New York, NY
pros: My experience is limited to the MBA program at Bard. The administration do an excellent job of organically growing a this already strong program. They are open to and act on new ideas and suggestions for improvement. I was given a high degree of latitude to develop my class how I saw fit given the needs in the business world. Support related to student or technical issues has almost always been swift and thorough. The faculty is talented and collaborative, and the students challenge me in every class.
cons: The program can be under resourced at times. That is to be expected with a new program that grows organically. No other cons to report.

job_title: Student Lab Monitor in Annandale on Hudson, NY
pros: You don't have to work much. Tasks include fixing printers and troubleshooting problems on PCs and Macs. Very easy job. Students can do their homework while working on the job. It is optional to arrange the chairs and computers in the lab neatly.
cons: Miminum wage, and they cap students' hours at 6 per week. The job can be boring at some point,  especially for long shifts. Some labs are very far form central campus and it takes a long walk to reach them.

review_title: You won't get a better paying job with benefits doing security work anywhere else.
job_title: Security Guard in Tivoli, NY
pros: Amazing pay, benefits, quiet college most of the week, not the typical college atmosphere. Many coworkers have a background in Law Enforcement.
cons: No movement potential. Shifts are taken by seniority so you'll be doing overnights for a long time. The Sr guards are on the way out leaving a fairly inexperienced guards working the campus. Only two shifts exist that have weekends off. Staff and Faculty tend not to appreciate Security until we're helping save lives or keeping the campus safe.

job_title: Security Officer/Charge of Shift in Annandale on Hudson, NY
pros: Promoted a safe campus environment, supervised 7-14 security officers and dispatchers/shift while responsible for 1,200 acres college campus with 1,800 students and 182 buildings.  Handled an average of 70 calls over three days, coordinated with EMT/police as needed, conducted random building checks, fire/intrusion alarms, trained all new officers, kept a daily log sheet and processed Incident Reports.
cons: I don't have to deal with to many inebriated students on a daily basis, specially on weekend

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Annandale on Hudson, NY
pros: It's a pretty rewarding job.  People come in and ask for your help. Pretty standard procedure for a tutoring position
cons: You tutor for 3 hour shifts in a window less room. Some people wait for you to give them the answer, which you very much shouldn't do.

job_title: Guidance Counselor in New Orleans, LA
pros: Love the students, flexible schedule, convenient location

review_title: The Upper Administration is Very Provincial
job_title: Associate Professor in Annandale on Hudson, NY
pros:
Academics might have many opportunities to build programs and the like here.

Faculty salaries are pretty good.
cons: Everything is about face time with the President.  Unless you lobby him constantly it is very easy to fall out of favor.  Many in senior management appear to be incompetent yes men/women.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Annandale-on-Hudson, NY
pros: Many great people work at Bard, both professors and staff. The location is gorgeous, if a little remote, but the city is just 2 hours by train. Your experience will depend a lot on what department you're hired into.
cons: Depending on your department, you can have either fantastic management or terrible management. Need to be pro-active about meeting people and forming a community.

job_title: Chinese Tutor in Waco, TX
pros: You get to work your peers, set your own hours, and set the pace with the students. If selected, the Learning Commons is a great opportunity for students needing a position for work/study.
cons: The students need the most help around your busiest time (finals). It's unavoidable.

review_title: Solid job, very slow in the summers

cons: Location can be a drag if you are more keen on larger city environments. It's not too far from NYC, but just far enough to be difficult to get to. Nature and scenery is very beautiful.

job_title: Recruiter in Annandale-on-Hudson, NY
